fields.fieldDescription: The Record ID (RID) for the investment deal.
The deal Record ID (RID).
The current investment amount (aggregate of all facilities circled).
The investment amount (aggregate of all facilities circled) that is allocated from the original amount.
The original investment amount stated on the commitment letter (aggregate of all facilities circled).
The investment type code and description.
The code for the transaction type.
Indicates whether or not this investment is pro-rata across all facilities in the deal.
Timestamp from when this row was created.
Timestamp from when this row was last updated.
User ID that created this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
User ID that last updated this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
Indicates that this investment is a trade and should affect the deal's trading limits.
Indicates whether or not this investment is part of a blow-up trade.
A numeric code from 1 - 9 representing the relative difficulty in closing the investment with this lender. The code is used in determining the salesperson's or trader's sales credit.
The code for the original investment.
"Number between 0 and 100 that represents the difficulty factor for selling the investment deal, referenced when assigning sales credit."
"The code for the object state during the life cycle (e.g. pending, awaiting approval)."
"The code for the object state category that describes the life cycle category (e.g. potential, actual, inactive)."
The Record ID (RID) for the buyer.
The Record ID (RID) for the location of the buyer.
The buyer location code.
The Record ID (RID) for the seller.
The code for the seller's location.
Indicates whether the buyer or the seller receives the benefit of a facility commitment reduction.
Indicates whether the circle is settling net or gross.
This indicator will be 'Y' when user wants to default circle outstanding decisions to be matchfunded
"Indicates that cashflows are shown from the point of view of the buyer,  only used for internal assignments and participations."
The target close date for the investment.  This date is 14 days after the later of the closing date of the deal with the borrower or the circle close date.
The pre-close date for the investment.
The date the investment letter was received from the investor.
The expected close date of the circle associated with the investment deal.
The Record ID (RID) for the syndicate pool.
The Record ID (RID) for the source agreement.
Indicates whether or not this is a highly leveraged transaction (HLT).
The code for the reason for cancellation.
The code for the currency associated with the investment .
The date of final approval for the investment.
The date the circle closed.
"The customer ID for the ""brought in by"" bank."
The textual entry for the time of commitment.
The date the investment was cancelled.

"This field is used for circle swaps only (i.e, a group of circles buys in one or more deals and sells in one or more different deals being swapped between the same parties). It is an id linking all these circles together."
"The buy sell code that identifies whether this is a buy, sell, swap, etc."
The Record ID (RID) for the contra circle for an internal circle.
Indicates whether or not this is a qualified buyer.
Expiration date for qualified buyer status.
Indicates whether or not the primary is an underwriter.
The code that identifies the status of the funding memo.
The code for the risk book associated with the investment .
The Record ID (RID) for the seller's location.
The Record ID (RID) for the third party.
The Record ID (RID) for the third party's location.
The code for the third party's location.
The Record ID (RID) for the sales team location.
Indicates whether the circle was traded flat (all previously accrued unpaid interest belongs to the buyer when it is paid).
"Indicates that although the circle was traded as usual, the seller expects to be paid its accruals through the settlement date by the buyer rather than the agent."
Indicates that the seller's interest and fee accruals through settlement which are to be paid by the buyer will be paid at settlement rather than when the borrower pays.
The date to which accrued interest and fees will be paid to the seller of the circle and from which accrued interest and fees will be paid to the buyer.
The Record ID (RID) for the participation agreement.
The percentage to be used in the rules for reducing underwriter amounts and for calculating remaining inventory.
The text that indicates the deal amendment number to which the circle is related.
The processing area code for the investment .
The Record ID (RID) for the marketing group.
The Branch Identifier
